alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 1:40PM MST until July 14 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE CAMP VERDE AREA... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 139 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Gaddis Wash, Verde River, Gap Creek, Cienega Creek, Bull Run Creek, Little Ash Creek, West Clear Creek, Cherry Creek, Chasm Creek, Grief Hill Wash, Little Sycamore Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camp Verde, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Middle Verde and Clear Creek Campgrounds. - This includes the following swimming holes... Bull Pen Day Use Area and West Clear Creek near the campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 216 and 237. Interstate 17 between mile markers 278 and 290.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
